intro: Hieracium tephroprenanthes, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are accompanied by lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Hieracium tephroprenanthes is often found in open habitats and can sometimes form dense colonies.
